intro: Cassuvium nicobarense, commonly known as the Nicobar cassuvium, is a rare flowering plant native to the Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Its roots are known for their medicinal properties, traditionally used in local remedies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
